lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role! Where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what we do!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's Dungeons & Dragons?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You will find out, Liam. He who ran it earlier for his daughter. Congratulations on them making it through the--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Bonegrinder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Bonegrinder, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Those kids, some of my kids, my daughter had some of the pie.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You weren't going to tell them what it was made of, and then you did.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wasn't, but I did.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You let them live?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You merciful lord.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, how much of them lived? It's Barovia, to be fair. Anyway, welcome. Before we hop into tonight's game, we have some announcements to get through. First and foremost, I believe, if Sam is ready, it looks like he's stretching himself. We have our fantastic sponsor, for campaign two since day one, our friends at D&D Beyond.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) D&D Beyond!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond everybody, they've been such great sponsors, putting up with my shenanigans for so long. So tonight I thought I would just do a simple, normal ad read for them. Just singing their praises of the service of the company, how they're making D&D fun and easy again. So I just wrote a little, quick little-- I left it at home on my printer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Stop right now."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Wow, guys, I suddenly feel-- I feel like that was a great D&D Beyond ad! And scene.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That really zigged when I thought it was going to zag.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was so good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will say, unfortunately, without Satan at your back, I don't think you're allowed to play Dungeons & Dragons anymore. It's kind of a requirement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You gave up your ticket. The table's not a free ticket, man. Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. If the 80s taught us anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam. And thank you, to our friends at D&D Beyond.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We put up a video on Wednesday announcing one of our first upcoming series here on Critical Role's channel entitled Handbooker Helper.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sue us!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We were discussing how excitedly the people in Hamburger Helper's marketing team are like, "Why this sudden uptick in interest in our brand?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're flying off the shelves!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sponsor us!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So if you guys want to sponsor Handbooker Helper, let us know. Yeah, so anyway, it's going to be a short form series. Bite-sized video snippets, introducing people who have either never played Dungeons & Dragons or want a bit of a refresher course on the 5th edition rules from the handbook, but in very easy to understand presentory fashion.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bite-sized segments!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Five minutes or less.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Marisha, did you have anything you wanted to mention on that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And on YouTube on Wednesdays. On our Crit Role YouTube.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hell yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, next Wednesday.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the Critical Role YouTube channel called "Critical Role" or "Crit Role"?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: youtube.com/criticalrole, I believe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But if you're confused, all that information is on critrole.com

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If anyone owns criticalrole.com, message us back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Big Helper.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The fucking glove. The glove is like--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've been really trying to talk to the glove.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Liam, if you want to talk a little bit about what and who.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So we're going to wait a little bit longer, but it's coming. I don't want to give away too much, but I'll tell you who's playing. We have La La, Sam, and Travis will be part of the game. And we are bringing in friends TJ Storm--

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And Erica Luttrell. Both great actors, fun to play with. Again, I don't want to spoil anything, but I will say that it will be focusing heavily on motherfucking werewolves!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (shouting) Motherfucking werewolves! (howling)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Late happy birthday present to Travis Willingham.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So excited. I'm glad we finally got TJ on, too, because he's great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you guys don't know TJ Storm, look up his stuff. He's a phenomenal actor, great physical performance capture and motion capture actor. I've worked with him on many video games, a lot of us have. He's phenomenal, but he's also the kind of guy who I had no idea was a huge D&D nerd until we got in an offhand conversation years ago. He's like this tall, muscular, long dreads, black dude.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's in the Karate Hall of Fame or something like that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. He's incredible and has been dungeon mastering for 20 plus years, I think. We've played a number of games together and he's awesome. So excited to have him on the show.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right then.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that a term?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't wanna speak for you, TJ.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was smooth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: DPTB?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Better than chunky.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, there you go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we use that all the time, please? Dick in the peanut butter!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great, that's what I'm going to hear at home all the time now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Congratulations.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Teach your son.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (baby talk voice) Oh, who's DPB? Who's DPB?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (baby talk voice) Little dick in the peanut butter? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I've already lost control and we haven't even started the game. Last but not least, when we get at the break, we'll be having our Wyrmwood giveaway. The giveaway will be requiring you to come over into the Critical Role chat room, twitch.tv/criticalrole. We'll keep you up to speed when all that's happening. I think that's it, unless we have anything else to mention.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, go to the store and check out shop.critrole.com. Did I get it right? There's t-shirts, and there's a bumper sticker that says something about the Traveler, and you know we all love that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Retro tee, critter cap, Mighty Nein tee, Vox Machina pin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dad cap!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They know what there is! And some pins, check it out. Maybe there's pins, maybe there's not. Maybe you should go check it out to find out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Could be anything!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the worst ARG element of our whole show's campaign. Go find out!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There might be a surprise. If there is, tell us!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that being said, let's go ahead and bring us into tonight's episode of Critical Role!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (caterwauling) [click, TV static] [groovy Critical Role theme]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've taken your time, decided on a new path, a new adventure ahead of you, loaded up your things and currently with your cart, horses, and selves together. You begin making your way towards the southern area of Zadash and out towards the roads ahead. So this is your very last chance: if there's anything you need to do in the city, or forever hold your peace.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I need to pee.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a constitution check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Too real.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we want to raid the adult bookstore one more time? Just kidding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21. You can hold it for three more days.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay good, 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're just going to make a sloshing sound when you walk for a while.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb has to find new garage sales to dive through.

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys reach the southern gates to the exterior of Zadash, with the creaking of chains and the heavy (thudding) as the large wooden barriers slowly drift open to allow you and a few other carts outward onto the main road. You glance out onto the southern hills below you in the Marrow Valley and you can see the faint dusting of distant snow that has begun to melt in the recent warmer days that have come. The roads themselves are slick and heavy with mud from the snow and rainfall that has managed to still seep in. You can hear hooves making their way through the mud as you push past the barrier. Now last time you were here, you recall seeing large numbers of military that had gathered of the Righteous Brand of which there are very few left, it looks like most have gone eastward and found their way towards the skirmishes you continue to hear about on the borders of Xhorhas and the Ashguard Garrison. The gates close behind you, and you begin making your way now free again in the Marrow Valley southward towards your destination of the Menagerie Coast. First off, who is going to be guiding this first leg of the path? That is three days of travel to Alfield along the road. Who's going to be keeping an eye out? All right, we have Caleb for that. Anybody helping Caleb?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll help Caleb.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You think you got it? All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Since we've traveled this once before. Did you want to join?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, ladies first if you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's all you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can sense and see light and cloud and matter and vacuum, this kind of expanse of everything and nothing between these long stretches. You feel like there's an absence around you, but the more time you spend, the more you adjust to the space, the more your vision clarifies, the more the darkness is not pure darkness but a weave of millions of tiny threads, all moving, faintly traveling in different directions, tugged by some unseen force independently. You watch one thread, you pick one focus, and you can see it pulling along. And it brightens and brightens and brightens until it reaches, in that tiny little infinitesimal push, a burst of light, and it changes direction. And you see in that space where that burst of light had happened, you see seven other shadow-threads begin to emerge from that point that then fade away to nothing, the thread having now curved and taken a different path. A choice, a decision made, and a different destiny for whatever that strange thread is following. And pulling back, you now see the thousands, tens of thousands, millions of these that all wander in their own independent, solitary directions, some crossing, some parallel, some alone. And you wonder what all of this means, and what this has to do with the essence of this device, the powers that it seems to impart, and what it is that the Kryn Dynasty has designs for. You come back in to your moment on the cart as you're rocking back and forth down the pathway, hearing the hooves on the muddy-- now getting drier-- portions of the roadway. You glance around at your friends and shake your head for a moment, and focus once more on the road before you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mr. Caleb--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's an old joke.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What are you playing with over there? Seemed really intent on whatever it was.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I'm thinking back on it now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ask Jester to show you the thingy in her bag.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, ignore that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's something we picked up the first time we came through Zadash.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Gotcha. Hey, Miss Jester? Apparently you picked something up in Zadash-- I'm supposed to see the thingy in your bag?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which thingy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know. Caleb was being very shifty about it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's some really questionable thingies in here, but you can see them if you want.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd like to see any questionable thing you may have.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, well, there's that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't want to know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that even natural?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. And then there's that thingy. Caleb doesn't know about it, but he will later. And then-- oh! Were you talking about this? It's this box.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What is this thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Well, inside of it--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's gone critical!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Open it up and just let your mind go and see what you think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to meditate into the box.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Too soon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Independently, you begin to pick up the themes and the ideas of what all these strange threads, these--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does this place make me feel a little uncomfortable?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No? It's-- it feels in a weird way like you're-- (bird sounds)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) They're in the rafters!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No it's good, it's good, leave it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm just turning it down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pigeons everywhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't feel unnatural. It feels like a view behind the curtain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is the best way I can describe it. But it doesn't bother you. It's a little cold and a little alien, but it doesn't feel unnatural.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull back, you feel something comes back with you. And as your consciousness refocuses, there's a slight shred of milky grey energy that withdraws itself and then, with a warm impact, disappears into your chest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Huh. I think I have a passenger, and that's interesting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you see the little ball, the little grey ball?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wasn't it weird?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is he inside of you now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He is. It is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you think it's an it, not a he?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm trying to not make assumptions.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hurry up and stuff that thing back in her bag.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's right. People are looking for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good to know. I'll keep-- mum's the word. Huh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's nice, right? It's like a little post-coital feeling, kind of.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wouldn't know, but--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Has everybody focused on that thing now?

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: I have.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I should probably do that at some point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You should probably experience this, it's interesting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are not allowed to-- you know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, no! I wouldn't (hums). I just want to look.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can't look at it, though, today.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why not?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because he already has it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tomorrow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have so many balls inside of you already.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, balls deep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lots of them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Leave it alone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, so close!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Razor's edge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, I'd like you to roll a perception check with advantage with Caduceus's aid.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you for bringing it back to the material plane.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is pretty good. That's an 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, okay. As you progress for the first couple of days, heading south along the road, camping without issue, at the beginning of the third day, when you've begun taking your camp and reassembling it, making your way back to the road--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Point of order: there's also a hut, now, as part of the nightly routine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do wake up and notice that there maybe have been a few tracks that made their way towards your camp. They appear to be hoof-based in nature, but had wandered and circled around and made their way beyond your location. Probably just something natural in the vicinity that was curious about what this strange dome was in the space where you had made camp. But you gather your things, you make your way onto your cart, and with the better part of the next-- the third day's travel, right as the sun begins to set, you can see ahead the small treeline that surrounds the now-glowing windows of the town of Alfield.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Back in Alfield.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Back to the beginning of our notes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is where Bryce lives, right? We should check in with Bryce.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it looking as we near it-- is it looking a little more put back together?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you begin to go closer, you can see-- while there's still light in the sky, you can see that there are a number of building structures that have been reframed, and it looks like there was both a volunteer effort, as well as a number of hired masons and volunteers, that are in the process of rebuilding a lot of what had been damaged or burned down when the gnolls had originally assaulted it the last time you were here. By the time you reach the actual streets, making your way along the one central thoroughfare that cuts across the center of town, you can see some of the folks who are finishing up their daily work. As they're losing light, some light up torches, and continue to work and toil into the early hours of the evening. Others begin to close up, taking their ladders down, finishing for the day's work, and make their way to local tavern or homestead to make food and bed down for the evening. But as you pass by, a few folks do notice your presence, look over at the cart, and recognize you, and wave in your direction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They wave and seem almost nervous, excited but both not quite sure how to act in your presence. You see one familiar halfling, who had previously lost his entire inn, who glances over in your direction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thadeus Candleglow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Damn, note taker.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's right there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten points to Gryffindor, fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're doing what we can."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much have you built back already?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, we've gotten the basis of the bottom floor mostly restored structurally. We're going to "try and fill in the walls, and then we'll head on to the second floor there. I surmise we probably "have another four months or so before we're up and operational."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not bad, though, really.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really good progress, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I can lend that to most of these fine folks who've been so gracious in helping." He points to a few other people who have either left or are in the process of packaging up their tools and materials as well. They kind of acknowledge and glance over. "I wish I could give you a room "to stay in. I'd do it free of charge, but--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't need one. We have this magical dome that we sleep in, now. It's really cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wow. Whoa."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should rent some of those out. I bet people would really like it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Magic domes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll get right on it."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shift pods.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wasn't going to say it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, anyway, I don't want to take any more of your time. I just saw you coming through and "wanted to say thank you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Thadeus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is Bryce in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They should be. I haven't seen them around very recently, but if you're going to find them "somewhere in here, they're probably--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Broad Barn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably at the Broad Barn. Or--" Actually, Bryce would be--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Candleglow? No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, Candleglow was the inn that he is currently--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's the Feed & Mead Tavern, there's Broad Barn, there's Crate and Barrel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bryce would probably be over at the Salt Trench."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The jail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, that's where they've been keeping their attention as of late." Look at you taking notes. I'm so proud.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No one else on this side of the table is going to take any meaningful notes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I have, they're just mostly--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's dick pics all over the place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's important, too!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's memory lane. I see a big head of something shaped like a bowling ball.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And this one looks like a poo in a bathtub.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is, it's a stinky-- but that was Caleb, I think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I remember that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good times.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm finding a bunch of old dumb jokes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a very good bathtub, it's got claw feet. I appreciate that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This isn't where we left-- no. This isn't where we left Reginald? No, okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's make our way over there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's a good idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, heading over to the eastern side of town, you start finding the edge of the forest where the street of Alfield comes to an end, and the furthest building towards the forest-- you've passed it before, but not spent much time in its proximity-- is a dark grey stone building with a dark, weathered wood frame set around it, torches set exterior, and it has the simple sign that says the Salt Trench Jail. There is one crownsguard who's kind of leaning against the wall. It looks like they're not asleep, but definitely not in full energy, per se. Long piece of some sort of a wheat dangling out of their mouth; they're chewing. "Hey, can I help you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, we're here to see Bryce.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll be right back."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He looked like he didn't even remember us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe he's new.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, he could be reinforcements.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We killed a whole bunch of gnolls for them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To be fair, I don't remember him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, Caduceus, you should probably be aware: we fought off a bunch of gnolls when we were making our way up through here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We cut off their ears and sold them for money.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What kind of gnolls, you ask? Regular.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I know what a gnoll is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you've heard of gnolls. You've never seen one, you've never encountered one, but as far as your knowledge goes, they're just nasty big dog people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sometimes they aren't regular, though-- sometimes they're undead ones.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Irregular gnolls.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. But we fought both.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Irregular ones.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Harder to fit in what we want to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, the guard comes back, pokes through the doorway. "May I ask who's asking?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, The Mighty Nein has come calling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were we called that back then?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, that's where you coined the name.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, good, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep, that's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, let me go check," and heads back in. About a moment passes and you hear some footsteps coming and there you see coming through the doorway Bryce, helmet off, they're still wearing their armor. They look a bit overworked, maybe not getting enough sleep, a little bit of dark circles under the eyes, but other than that healthy. Their blond, shoulder-length hair has a soft curl to it, is pulled up in the back, and looks to be tied to keep out of the way. As they come through the door frame, a smile on their face. "I wasn't expecting company, let alone such welcome--"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nabend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's good to see you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What are you doing here? You working here now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm working wherever it's necessary. I keep watch on here, I help the Starosta maintain "general matters here with the Crownsguard, but stationed wherever it's necessary. We're a bit "light on manpower given the bulk of it is required now to the eastern side of the Empire."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, so, if we're going to commit a crime, now would be a good time, huh?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "In theory, which is why I'm not sleeping as well. But it's good to see you, Jester."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How has it been? Busy? Peaceful?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Both."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Any trouble here, at home?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "None, thankfully. We took them down last week, but it was decided that recovering some of "these gnolls that you had slaughtered and-- as garish as it was-- placing their heads as a "warning on the outskirts of town prevented, for a while, any sort of incursions. Seemed to be a "decent deterrent. However, the smell got a bit intense for the farmers and we decided to dispose "of them. But everything seems fine. We're far enough from all that chaos to the east. How's "everything been with you? Last I saw you, you were heading to Zadash. I apologize, it took a little "bit with the chaos here, but I just sent a report up to the Lawmaster up there. Orentha should know "of your deeds soon."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you for that, that's very kind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you just call us The Mighty Nein or did you describe what we look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I gave a brief description."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm new.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right. What's your name?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're a lot shorter than the last one they--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bryce. Bryce Feelid."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Introduced me to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's all right. Pleasure to meet you. You are very tall and... strange."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I've noticed everybody else is very short. It's fascinating.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, welcome to Alfield. Any friends of these are friends of ours."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pleasure to make your acquaintance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. Are you passing through? Or you've come to stay for a bit?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Passing through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, maybe stay for the night before moving on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, of course, of course. You need not worry about finding lodging, we can have that arranged."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, wow, thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, I have a little bit more business to attend "to and then I'll be off my shift and perhaps I'll join you for drinks."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Party time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Just a moment. If you wouldn't mind, go ahead and let Crute know that you've arrived at "the Feed & Mead tavern and I'll meet you there in an hour or so."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's lovely to see you all."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You too! I'm glad you're not in the war right now!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Me too." Bryce turns around and then comes back. "There's one, your other friend with the–"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Molly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm sorry for your loss."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, come, I'll meet you soon and we'll have drinks in his honor."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then Bryce makes their way back inside the building. You guys are welcome to do anything else you wish to prepare for, though it is starting to get into the evening hours and based on your previous experience in Alfield, you know this is one of those towns that primarily shuts down post-sunset. This is mostly a farming town.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's halves and halvsies, you know?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know, everywhere that I've been with you so far, people seem to be really happy to see you. It's a sign, in my opinion.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This might have been the first town we did good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think that's right, actually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because we kind of got a guy–

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Arrested?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Arrested and thrown in jail for--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: An indeterminate amount of time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but then we were helping other people, though, at the same time. So.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This was the first one we made a clean, positive impact, though. Minimal collateral damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Came through in the black, not broken even.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No IOUs or you know--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caleb, do you need to buy paper here or anything?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I am all set.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, just making sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go to the Feed and the Mead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Crute recognizes you as you enter. "It's good to "see all of you again. Welcome. Please, sit down. I will prepare food, I suppose, for many more than I "was expecting."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For Bryce too. They're coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good to know."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I use Thaumaturgy to open all of the windows!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (crashing) All of the windows slam open loudly. There's the sound of breaking glass on the far side as one of the windows is shattered from the impact. Wind swoops in and you watch as Crute-- who's faced away, making the way to the kitchen-- stops and goes, "(groaning)."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Memories!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Crute returns with some basic foods– most everything here is everything from lightly cooked vegetables or boiled vegetables to some treated and salted meats. They don't have a wide variety of dishes here, but it is still delicious and very classic home-on-the-road food. Bryce eventually comes and joins you; the first time you've seen them out of their formal attire and armor. Bryce comes in with a light blue soft tunic over some light brown leggings and comfortable boots. Very relaxed and casual as they sit down at the table and take an unclaimed tankard and leans back in the chair. "Well, I think we've all earned this. Cheers."

lines.name: SAM, TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Cheers!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "To friends, here and not."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Nott!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And Nott."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, to me. Any crazy news around here? Or just the normal stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The normal recovery. Thankfully only one and a half fields were torched in the gnoll "onslaught, so hasn't been a huge detriment to our farming schedule. Other than that, it's been the "Righteous Brand passing through.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The people we rescued from that cave nearby? Are they all fine, not, you know–?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's one of them right over there." One of the individuals that came up and offered to buy you drinks earlier, you can see it's one of the older, bearded gentlemen who looks to be a little-- you recognize him now, once it's pointed out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Totally recognize him now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ey! Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ey! Told you they remembered me!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Totally know exactly what you're talking about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They never forget a face, The Mighty Nein."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He was crying when we rescued him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He was really dirty, covered in a lot of–

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Soot and dirt, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bryce continues on a bit and tells you about how: "There's word that the Ashguard Garrison has fallen. I've been doing the best I can to keep my "ear to the ground on things happening east. It's far enough away where no one here's worried, but I "have friends in Bladegarden and who were stationed at the Rockguard, which is the other garrison. If "one's fallen. I worry for the other. But I know they're sending all of their forces that way and--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, when did this happen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did hear about this from one of the town criers a little over a month ago when you were leaving on The Gentleman's errand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I remember that very well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kind of led to the influx of people going out?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's when Dairon decided to go, right? Or was she already out there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably. I have to look back at my notes again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's okay. The time period in there-- it's somewhere in that space.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The trend is that it's pushing closer in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "From what I've heard they've kept it at bay and there are intents to retake the garrison, but "there were well over 2,000 lives lost and I don't know how much there is specifically to say about, "but the rumors are that the sky over that pass, over the garrison itself, lie as dark as midnight "throughout the day even."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa. They've got some serious magic stuff over there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there any word from the south? We happen to be heading that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh! That makes sense, if you're leaving Zadash. Well, in times of warfare– and I know "we've been notified of this via the information routes to the rest of the crownsguard and the "watchmasters to keep an eye– but I do believe entrance to the Empire is being very carefully "inspected. You shouldn't have an issue leaving – it's coming back in, during a time of conflict "like this might take a while.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there anything that can speed up that process? Some papers or forms or stamps?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Coin.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Global Entry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can't say that those at the Wuyun Gates are going to be more partial to what I have to say, "but I can try."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Couldn't hurt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we know anyone else that's important?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anywhere.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We know the Starosta here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know the Starosta here. He'd probably would have some say.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Starosta here? Yes, but, if I recall, the last time you spoke wasn't on the most "positive terms either."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Some tricks you may get one shot with. I'd be worried. He tends--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe I could give back that letter and he can give us a new letter! Because you don't even want it anymore.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's not true, Jester. I still have some plans for that letter. It does have his signature on it, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we could just forge another one!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, heck yeah! I'm really good at that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't heard any of this."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, sorry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, keep talking, please. Just know that I've heard nothing," as they put their fingers in their ears.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now's the time to do it! There's not a lot of people here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know, protocol."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let them enjoy their drink, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Exactly. A little plausible deniability doesn't hurt either."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How is the Starosta? Is he still a pain in the ass?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Always, but he does good work and he's spearheaded organizing many of these "reconstruction efforts and maintaining a means of getting influxes of gold from Rexxentrum. The "crown has been very good in sending money as necessary because the Starosta has been so "diligent in the connections he has. So, yes, he's a prick and he's a bit of a pain in the ass on our "end, but, I mean, he's not terrible at his job. So what can I say?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's a bit of a prick and what I've heard? It's not that big of a prick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (singing) "Da da da da da da. I have to work with him often."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just from what I heard. I didn't see it see it, but people talk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, did you often "see it see it"?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I often see what what?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: See it, see it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like? Penises? Wieners? I've seen so many penises.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's the best penis you've ever seen?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, hold on, hold on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I still want that question answered, but he can go ahead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a point of clarification, we're talking voyeuristically because of your household, you mean?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, like you had a peep window or something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's the matter? Even if she hadn't seen them voyeuristically--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just want to understand what we are talking about. You know, up close is different than from behind a boudoir.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I've seen them mostly not when they knew that I could see them. If that's what you mean.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm curious about your– you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why are you so interested in people's sex lives, Caleb?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is true, though. Like, why?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Actually, I'm with Beau now. I want to know your favorite one you've ever seen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, what's your best dick?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My best dick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pick one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If it's too hard to pick, you can do top three.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Honestly? I saw Molly's when we were in the bath house.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was it? We must have all seen it, but–

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was it tattooed?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How did it compare?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Reminding everyone that we have all seen each other naked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Molly's was pretty good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In terms of just being giant or, like, well-proportioned? Symmetrical?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was really nice and it was a good color.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Only because when I saw it last, it was a bit of a mess. It was a little bit Egg McMuffin, if you know what I'm saying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, when it was clean, it was lovely.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Traditional Zadash breakfast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, lord.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: DPB.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bryce at this point goes, "Well, folks, I think this is my cue to get some rest. It's been "great catching up a bit with all of you. Stay safe."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You as well, yes. We wish you nothing but the best.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You as well."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cheers again!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Cheers again. If ever you find your way near this podunk side of the Empire again, you'll "always have a place to stay in Alfield. Heck, maybe if all this business to the east is finished "before long, and I get some time off, maybe I'll come visit you up in Zadash."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's been a while."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should come visit us over in the Menagerie Coast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't been there since I was a child."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just leave!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just leave your post! Go AWOL! Come with us!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's too many people here that depend on me. I can't."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, you're a good person.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're such a good--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're a good person.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, but still.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I appreciate that." They stand up leave a few coins on the table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your money's no good here! I'll fucking kill you if you try to pay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, okay! All right!" They take the coins, finish the drink, walk over to the bar, and set them on the counter anyway, and then walk away. "Good night."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And they walk away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was an escalation, Nott. I feel like one, two, and then just nine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did we scare them away?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't want to feel like a burden on anyone, you know?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here's a question. Once we get to the Menagerie Coast, I feel like we'll have a good sense of how Nott is at fitting in. What is it like for--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Honestly, I've never seen any goblins there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I haven't either.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I can wear my mask, and I got these lovely gloves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: These are so creepy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? What are you talking about? They look like real fingers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ew.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's also hot. Is it hot there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a bit warmer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's warmer. It's nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A little humidity, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You might not want mittens, you know?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Skin mittens.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll see how long I last.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Leave them on, you cook your fingers in some balsamic, it'll be great. Smell real nice when you pull them out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't smell good to begin with.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like a cast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You get that cast off, you're like (sniffs deeply).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're fine when you're next to me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's true. Stink-ouflage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That old chestnut.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we sleep here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to sleep here, it's nighttime.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, all right, didn't know if we wanted to sleep in the bubble, but, you know--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, a roof is good. Let's have a roof.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did they say where we were going to be put up, our lodging?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Here, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, where we are?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's easy. We stumble upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the room is already provided. Your delightfully pleasant evening purveyor of down pillows and blankets, Crute, is ever eager to show you where you can leave him the fuck alone. You manage to find your rooms and rest for the evening. The following morning, you gather your things, the cart has been taken care of.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could I have, before we went to sleep, sent a message to my mama, letting her know we might be passing through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed, you can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. In the morning, breakfast is provided for you. There are a few folks that are in here finishing their breakfast before going out in the fields, going about their daily business, and, as you descend to your breakfast meal, you watch half the room go quiet as they all watch you. Throughout the rest of the meal, they lock eyes in a very "I don't know how to act" kind of a way, but not in a bad way. Pardon. Some of you especially aren't used to being the person that walks into a room and being stared at, but the energy is different here. There's definitely more of a reverence. It's kind of a nice change of pace.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Morgen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you say? Morgen?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's Zemnian for "good morning."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Morgen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, morgen. Guten morgen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do I say, "I would like some pastries, please?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Liam does not know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's too complicated to teach. The accent is very difficult.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some of the Zemnian Critters out there will tweet you the pronunciation.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Liefen, laufen, loafen, loben.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's actually very close. That's kind of close. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was the name of the town that Gustav is stuck at?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trostenwald. That's the next one on your trip.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's the next one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the final town to the south.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're in Alfield. That's where I stole mail. Okay, I was getting confused if we were in-- Okay. Cool. Do you guys want to stop in down in Trostenwald on our way?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's on the way, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The last good thing that we could do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, the nostalgia factor of seeing where we all, you know, got hitched.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sure he would also like to know about Molly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. Yeah, that's a good point. We should make a stop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, I never really thought about the fact that when you're with someone when they die, it's kind of your responsibility for forever to tell anyone who doesn't know what happened.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. Never goes away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That kind of sucks. So let's keep sharing bad news.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Well, hey, after we pass Trostenwald, we'll get a break from that shit for a while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really pretty, the ocean.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have you ever been out of Empire?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, furthest south I've been, I think, is Trostenwald.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Same.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The water is really blue. I think you guys will like it. Yes, Nott, even you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope, no thanks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You could continue your swimming lessons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really blue, and it smells like fish!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's nice. I like fish.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Salt on the wind, it's amazing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's go see it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get your horses ready for the next leg of your journey. If you want to collect feed for the horses along the way, since you've been traveling for a few days, if someone wants to mark off--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure, let's just do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say another gold worth of feed that you--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will pay for that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, Caleb, save your gold for paper.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's done and done, it's already happened.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or incense.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm good. I've stocked up. I am plush. I have more coin in my pocket than I ever could have imagined, and I have already spent most of what we made.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you want some more?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just a little mad money or anything?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, I want some more.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I'm good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, continuing south, Caleb, are you maintaining your position on the cart?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll give my position up to Caduceus or Jester, either one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll ride with Caduceus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll help you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it'll be fun.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, you two take it, then.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Caleb takes a break at the back as Caduceus makes his way to the front of the cart, grabs the reins. Jester, you go ahead and plop alongside. You eventually turn your way heading westward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think I've done this before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're good with animals, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah, no, you just got to ask permission before you do anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which you can do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah. I ask permission to any animal I interact with, anything I eat, and it's always a conversation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You ask permission to ride the horse?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I say we're going to be-- Well, I explain to the horse that we're going to be moving south and I'd really appreciate their cooperation in the process, and how long we expect to be going for.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Out loud, do you do this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, just checking. I didn't know if you had some mumbo jumbo.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, can you do it without-- Can you talk without talking, is that a thing you can do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (mumbling) I don't think so. Am I talking?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope. Probably take ten minutes actually trying to do that before we get going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, but you go ahead and ask permission of the horses.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as Caduceus comes and quietly talks to each of the horses, and it seems ridiculous at first, but as he finishes talking to the horse, the horse nudges alongside him and gives a hoof clop on the ground.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're a seven-foot Bob Ross, I love it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Manners will get you everywhere.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Manners.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, Caduceus gets up onto the cart next to Jester, pulls on the reins, and with that, you guys begin to make your exit from Alfield a second time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Twinkle, twinkle, little star, how I wonder what you are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? You're really good!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's some black magic right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) I do that for way too long on the road.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's really impressive, and you sound like a kid that fell down the well when you're doing that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know if you can just now do that, or if you've always been able to do that, and then Ronin's your eventual payment of the contract.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Firstborn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, exactly. As you guys are exiting Alfield, a few more folks come out to the street to watch you leave. Some faces familiar: a child, a woman, people that you recognize as individuals you had helped make their way out of the mines long ago, and you see them wave, and they all say, "Goodbye."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bye!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A kid quietly raises a hand, smiling, too shy to say anything, and with that, you make your way past the final buildings, out of Alfield and back onto the road south.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw man, we saved their lives. That's pretty cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're awesome, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two days' travel to Trostenwald from Alfield, so which one of you wants to helm the first watch?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take first watch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah, I was going to help him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so roll with advantage on your perception check, please.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, nothing gets by me, unless I-- Well, no, that's a natural 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ho! Boom-shaka-laka-laka!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to say that's my help. That's me helping.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah, you're just pointing at things. Got it, got it. Yep, got that. Yep, oh, got that. Got that, yep. Where? Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Towards the end of the first day's travel, around what would be roughly 5:00, 5:30 in the afternoon, as you're keeping an eye out, you glance over what looks to be-- and you do find a few clusters of stone and rock that break up the rolling hills and tall grass that make up a large part of the southern part of the Marrow Valley that you're used to. You, who come from a very northern, borderline tundra north of the Savalierwood--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's tundra, except for my little patch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, taiga in places. You can see this very green and open field is a whole new experience to you, and you're enjoying the details of it as you pass by: the field mice that occasionally scurry across the road and get snatched up by a hawk, and you're like, yep, that's how it happens.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fair play.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Careful crossing the-- (cawing).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're glancing about, you can see a lot of these natural stones placed, and you see one cluster of stones that doesn't look naturally placed; they're leaned at an odd angle. If it had been placed at, or if it had been at that angle for a while, it would've eventually settled.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That doesn't look right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What doesn't?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The field?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now, if I were inclined to be a trap or an ambush of some kind, or-- Those rocks shouldn't be that way, that's all I'm saying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you glance over, you can see three stones, and one of them is about this big, it's a pretty heavy stone, and two longer slab stones, and they're all leaned against each other to look natural, but Caduceus doesn't seem to feel that way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe somebody is sitting in the little alcove.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's giving me the bad feelings.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we go attack it?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The rocks?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, I'm okay if you are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to, like--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Never had a rock really hit back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hop off the cart and, like--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are you going?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How far away is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about, from where you are now, as you've traveled closer, it's about 80 to 100 feet to the left off the road.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where are you going?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to throw a little rock as hard as I can towards it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Please be a good strength check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This looks a little weird to me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's not good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's my mime.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11. It arcs, falls maybe about ten feet short in the grass. No reaction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to use "Thaumagurgy" to cast my voice very loudly behind the other side of the rocks. Thaumaturgy, it just got stuck in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thauma-gurgy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thauma-gurgy! I want to use my Thauma-gerchy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as far as Thaumaturgy, you can't throw your voice so much as you can amplify the volume.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, so I can't throw my voice, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say you can throw it a little bit. You can't flank it, per se, but you can give it a little more of a force from one side, I'll say.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hang on a second, I can do tremors in the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if you want.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So I'm going to start tremoring the ground right over by those rocks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It shakes a bit, and you can see some bits of loose rock on top of this weird stone construct begin to vibrate, fall off the side. No reaction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe somebody's buried there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I poke my head between them. What are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's going on?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The rocks look a little weird, I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The rocks look weird? What does that mean?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It means the rocks look weird.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They giving you a bad feeling?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're giving me a bad feeling. I don't have a lot of bad feelings.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's go check it out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe they're a trail marker.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Have you ever seen a painting where someone tries to paint stars, but the stars don't look right, because they're the wrong kind of random? That's the wrong kind of random.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I send Frumpkin to go look at the rocks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe it's a secret entrance to something!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're like, "Really?" So Frumpkin's heading up? (meowing) Frumpkin gets low to the grass--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The random nature makes and the random that man makes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check for Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin does a little pass around the side, and there doesn't appear to be anybody in or around them, from what Frumpkin can see.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, let's go take a look, then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go knock them over.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can he climb to the tippy-top?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Frumpkin leaps onto the top and perches up there. (meowing)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm looking down at us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a strange view to see yourself walking towards yourself. It's like playing Resident Evil 1, where you have the locked camera.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Turn around!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's technically how Shakäste sees the world, when you think about it. It's all of existence through a series of Resident Evil camera angles. The Duchess, man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That makes me a little sad, on a fundamental level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, he can turn a lot better.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Getting in between the two angles and having to go back and forth?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No left, right, left, right, ugh!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Having to do K turns as a person is rough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all slowly approach this strange pile of rocks settled here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Trees above us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's mostly open, rolling hills.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we near where the gnoll mine was?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you're days away. That was east of the city. You guys are heading south.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you say how tall the rocks are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All together, probably about four feet tall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does it look like there is anything buried, any digging done here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check, if you want to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you get down inside--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, 25. As you get down to the stones, there's the one larger central stone and there are the two ones laid against it. There's a very small space in between there, and you get inside and begin to look around the ground, and you feel down, and there's nothing. It's mainly dirt and dry brush and dead grass that's been pushed in that centerpiece. You reach up, and your hand touches something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Treasure!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It feels like a satchel, or a leather sack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you have?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a bingo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need me to come?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's just bingo, Caleb.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you find some paper?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need me to touch it to disarm it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hold on. I send Frumpkin to get down by my hand to look up so that I can look at what I'm grabbing, to make sure that it is not one of those bags with teeth or something that I have read about in fairytale stories.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, we found a few of those bags.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One moment!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caleb, Caleb, Caleb! What did you find, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Some loot. Maybe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pull it out!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if it's a trap?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, first Frumpkin goes to look, so I can see what I'm seeing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why don't you let Nott look?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin crawls inside and looks up, and there is, indeed, a leather pouch, roughly the size of a baseball, that has been jammed up between the rocks to the point where it's being held up underneath out of sight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there poop in it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pull it out! See what we've got!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't like all these euphemisms. I pull the bag out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you pull the bag out from the rock... it comes free.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good fake out. I like it. Textbook.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Open it up!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now you die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you open the bag... it's fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Too many. Two times!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know, let me have my little fun. You open inside, and you already hear the impact of a bunch of tiny stones and as you look inside, there are gems in here. It is a collection of cut jewels.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Diamonds? Are there diamonds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Someone will probably be coming by to try and pick this up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Somebody's going to be so pissed!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb takes the bag and he puts it in Jester's hand, and starts to quietly dance around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) We got lots of jewels here! They are so pretty! We should get in the cart and drive away really fast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's fine, but give me a second. We should make sure there's no tracks. We clear all the tracks away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to empty the jewels out and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, so they're not in that bag? Yeah, let's replace them with other rocks and put them in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, if somebody left jewels for somebody else to pick up, and it's full of rocks, you might get that person killed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but it's not us!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's put a bunch of rocks in it! It's fine. They're not going to die.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're not all good yet; we're trying to do good. There's gray in the middle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They'll probably open the bag before they deliver it, you know? Then they'll see it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take one gem and say: This is a six-foot tall stack of paper! We're taking them!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Rocks, rocks, rocks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You fill the small leather sack with rocks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And one little piece of dried poo that I found that was an animal's.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you find it in your pants?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You got to know where to look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Follow your nose.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we leave a note throwing them off our track? Like, "Oh, you know who took this? Fuck "you! Love, The Iron Shepherds," or something like that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah. You thought you were getting jewels, but you're getting rocks and shit!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And poop! Dried poop! Yeah, I'll write that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Love, The Iron Shepherds.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While everybody's arguing, I'm going to sit down and Detect Magic as a ritual.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a ten minute casting time to cast as a ritual? Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to start going around and trying to mess up our tracks, maybe leave a few deeper footprints walking the other way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a survival check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, boy. 19. Naturally.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. I believe it's wisdom?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus zero. I'm better with other things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you trying to do, Jester? Someone over here was trying to do something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, ritual casting Detect Magic, but that's ten minutes of stoppage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm walking back towards the cart.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're keeping an eye out for anything else happening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you do that ritual on the cart as we drive away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check, Beau?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am busy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's focusing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Keeping an eye out, it doesn't appear that there's any immediate sign of anyone approaching. By the time you finish completing the ritual, you do a quick pass over. There are many magical auras around you, but they're your friends. The various objects they're wearing and equipped light up, but there's nothing beyond expected.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This place is clear. Let's get the hell out of here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rubies and emeralds. Because of a really high perception check on Caduceus's end.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My notebook, I don't know what happened to it when we moved, so that's why I can't take notes anymore.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So many dicks lost to the move, oh no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I lost all my dicks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Our group inventory, though, is nonexistent right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll find the notebook somehow. Don't worry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you be in charge again? You're fired.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want me to be in charge of money, I'll be in charge of the money. It reminds me of Caduceus. It's a unicorn. Ashley gave this to me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we were saying we should probably skedaddle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make your way south along the trail. You have one more day of travel before you get to Trostenwald. Caduceus, are you still leading?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I'm feeling good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll one more perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll help him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Find another geocache! Come on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are heading southward on the second day, Caduceus, you notice coming up over one of the hills a single horse with a single rider moving at a very quick speed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Behind us or ahead of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Heading towards your direction, heading northward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That looks like somebody on the run.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) That looks like somebody who's going to pick up some jewels.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, yeah, maybe that's the guy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody, look casual!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, no, we're inside an invisible--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to change my appearance. To a grungy human with shaggy hair.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I see him do that. I do the same thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, Caleb?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A long orange goatee, a puffy red beard, and scruffy long red hair. Human Tasmanian Devil.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I make myself look like a young human girl with lots of freckles and big, poofy red hair.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We look related, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone else?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're hiding in the invisible cart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's how it works, right? Everyone in the bed is--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone in the bed is not visible. They are held behind the illusion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's driving the cart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I jump in the invisible part of the cart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the rest of you head back into the illusion, you continue moseying forward on the cart, and you hear the hooves getting louder and closer. As they go screaming by you at the side, there's that moment where time seems to slow, as you see that individual, their face mostly covered by a dark red or purple bit of cloth, like a facemask. A hood that is up but slipping back, and a little bit of tousled black hair, with a little bit of salt and pepper on the sides. A large cloak underneath, with a cloth mantle over that's also blowing behind slowly. Darkly dressed, like a highwayman that is in the process of trying to get somewhere quickly, whether it be with a delivery or trying to meet up with somebody. In that moment you watch them glance out the side of their eye at the two of you in the cart, and then race off. Not slowing, not stopping.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dark salt and pepper hair?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was Travis.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I put Travis in the game. Meta!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You couldn't see how long his hair was underneath?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the hood was starting to come back from the wind as the rider tried to keep it down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pale skin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, from the little bit of face showing around the eyes, it looked like it had been fairly tanned, probably from sun and a lot of travel out in the open. They took one quick but very detailed glance towards the two of you and then screamed on ahead northward, past the cart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're very quick, you!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We do okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then you continue southward. For the better part of the next day, you eventually can see, as you come around one bend, where some of the larger hills are beginning to weave around the road as it begins to curve left and right. In the distance, a number of birds are starting to fly in larger flocks and encircling what now reveals itself to be the familiar sight of the Ustaloch below. You can see ahead of you the city of Trostenwald, where a lot of your crazy adventures together began. It's not quite dusk. You're about two hours from dusk. You begin to make your way down towards the city itself. It's as busy and lazy as you remember. As you reach the outer streets of the township, there are people coming up and down the various streets with carts and wares. You can see folks that are passing through, hopefully on a trade route. Some folks that look like they're stuck here. A lot of carts that are built up on the outside that are either waiting for some sort of sign to continue travel, or are still packing up before they leave for whatever their next destination may be. What would you like to do? If anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we stopping here? We've got to stop for the night, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably. It's getting late.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, do people hate us here? I've forgotten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no. I don't think they do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We got a stern warning as we left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could go see Gustav.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, why don't we stop by the Nestled Nook?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, if it's easy. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See who's there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, do sit down. Drinks? Rounds? What are you asking for?"

lines.name: SAM
