lines.text: Well, we're in Trostenwald, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have a trost here; that's what you do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Trost it may be. All right. But you're in Trost, there's quite a few Trostenwald brews."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Von Brandt for me, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Von Brandt it is."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Same for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, table of von Brandts."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Milk for me, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kluss, the clerk, the reedy-looking young man, is in the back, currently going through paperwork and trying to keep tabs on a number of ledgers and business elements. The evening is yours. Do you wish to do anything, or are you going to bed down for the evening and continue the following day?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I flag down Adla.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Adelaine?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Adelaine? (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Adla for short.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hello? You looking for something?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I was curious if you've seen Gustav around. Tall, thin, elvish-looking man.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is he not in jail?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think he's in jail, isn't he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm sorry, I don't think I know a Gustav."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought he was working off his debt. I thought he was-- right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He was working off his debt. You don't know the specific circumstances of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Interesting. All right, thanks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course, sorry. Would you like anything else?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Another round of drinks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right away."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could I have some chocolate? And some milk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll see what we have in the back." Adelaine goes off, and does return with milk and-- it's a little old, it's starting to get some of that white powder fringe to the chocolate, but it's functional.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! I heat it up and I put it in my milk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm glad to see your prickly demeanor is still in shape.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, well, I didn't have you around for a little bit, keeping me in check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I tried to do okay, though. I think I did all right. Did I do okay, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wasn't paying attention.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could I get a bowl, please?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A bowl is retrieved for you quite easily. As Yorda throws it on the table, "Would you like "something in the bowl, dear?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I was going to borrow from a friend, but yeah, I will take a little bit of milk in it, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Milk it'll be." And she goes and returns with a bowl about half-filled with milk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I put it on the floor and I snap him into existence. There you go, buddy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does he have to eat?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I was going to ask.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But he likes it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I understand that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look down under the table, at Frumpkin sitting at the bowl going--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He really likes it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cat noises)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No no. No no no!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, with cats, it's really all of their emotions are your emotions projected on them, anyway, so that's how it works with cats. They feel nothing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is painfully true, in my case. And I tell Frumpkin to start drinking milk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (unwilling groan)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a little bit. Put some fat on those fey bones of yours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Frumpkin begrudgingly, at the command of his master, "enjoys" a bowl of milk--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can't win!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Please, send me your emails for abusing my fey magical cat!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine. Frumpkin can drink milk. Frumpkin just has no need for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's like Vax, near the end.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a placebo for the master. It's like, "If it makes the master happy, I'll drink this "milk for you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, like Vax, near the end.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, exactly. And you get the sense, too, that the entire time that Frumpkin is drinking from this bowl, Frumpkin is making direct eye contact with Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we try to see Gustav tonight?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, it's about dusk. By the time you've come in the city, you've come to the inn, you've got food and drinks, and you settled for a bit, it's about dusk now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, but before we go over there, are we going to plunk down 2,000 gold to get this near-stranger out of debt?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think we have that. Do we want to do a little--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We all do if we pitch in together, I'm sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think that's true, but we could do a token.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have almost that much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have almost that much? Holy mo-- (gasps) You have so much money!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's obscene.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I never pay for anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You guys have bought everything for Nott.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you want to bail him out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Heavens, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You bailing him out tonight?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I didn't say that--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is so generous, Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like you're putting words in my mouth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I feel like we should just carry you through the town, crying out, "Gustav's release "paid by this sweet little girl!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So generous.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin side-eyes you while you both drink the milk together.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should put some chocolate in that. It's better.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Great for cats.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, we could go in the morning, it doesn't matter.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, let's go now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we can wheel and deal with him. Pay a lump sum now and consider it debt repaid, time served.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And if not, I feel like we should keep a certain amount for ourselves for our travels, but we could leave a token sum to help him on the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, where are you guys headed?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To the jail or wherever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the stockade. The stockade here is where you had previously--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Talk to Lawmaster Norda.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Remember that? Norda and Yorda.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, just to fuck with you. All right, so you guys make your way to the stockade, and it takes a brief intro to the crownsguard outside before you are brought back in. One of them recognizes you from your previous encounter a few months back and brings you to Norda's office, a familiar place you've been. Norda-- you can see the dwarven woman, with very a tense and tired and just kind of over-it expression on her face, glances up at you all. "All right, so it's been a bit."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, the good news is, nothing else died since you've come back. That's--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Excellent news. Very glad to hear that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "--positive. So, when are you leaving?"

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Soon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Great news. That's wonderful."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the morning.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not everyone likes us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why are you in my office at this hour?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're just trying to achieve one thing, and that was hopefully to get some eyes on our good friend Gustav, if we could.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You want to see Gustav?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If that is permissible, ja.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sighs) "Fine," She gets up from behind the desk and goes and reaches into this cubby and pulls out a ring of keys and, "Follow me." Leads you back down into the familiar stair down below to a cell where a couple of you have been held before. And there you can see, on the far end, there is a cell, and within this dark, subterranean interior with the faint burning torchlight gives this ominous red-orange flicker to the normally shaded interior. You see there, slumped against the wall, enjoying a bowl of some sort of gray, mushy substance, a not abused-and-filthy, but a-little-rough-around-the-edges Gustav. Not chained, not shackled, and there is a chair and there is a bed. You can see of the jail cells here, which are designed to just be abysmal, this one-- some pains have been made to make it a little more comfortable.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Extended stay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roughly how long has it been since we were here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roughly about two and a half months, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How time flies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks like he's been doing some hard work, probably a little thinner than even his previously thin form was, but he's there. He approaches the edge of the bars. "By what might I have the pleasure of you all coming to see me?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well. Pleasure. You know, we meant to return sooner, but we've been a bit held up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's all right. I myself have, as well, don't worry."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: About that. We're not staying in town. We are leaving in the morning, actually, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, do you like it in this jail cell? Maybe it's really comfortable, huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, it's not preferable by any means, but it certainly beats going in here against my will."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much-- if it's not too presumptuous, how much do you have left to work off?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, at the rate we've been going?" And he looks over towards Norda. Norda's like, "If he "keeps working as hard as he has been, he's looking at another seven, eight months, maybe."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about remuneration, an amount? What is left for him to work off?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have to go look at the books, but I can go check."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, could you please?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What, you going to pay him off?"

lines.name: LIAM, LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: (ambiguous noises)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Barter it at the very least.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe just a little something towards it, if we could.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gustav, at this point, leans forward and goes, "You are all very sweet, and I greatly "appreciate it, but this is my debt to pay, not yours."

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Well...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could you go look up that number for us, please?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Norda goes, "You two keep an eye." And the two crownsguard approach and get a bit closer while Norda heads back upstairs, Gustav still pressed against the bars, his head peeking through the two sides, bit of scraggly hairs falling in front of his face. "No, but I'm completely "serious. This is my burden. I chose it. You've all done good work here, and--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, I lived it, so I remember, but for Caduceus, can you remind me why Gustav was locked up again? (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The circus and the fucking--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, but what did he do wrong?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He convinced the town that we all met--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He was responsible for the circus, that's all, he just took responsibility.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But that wasn't-- how would he know? This is an innocent man! He didn't do anything bad, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would love to have an insight check, insight check from Caduceus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a (counting) 27.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm rolling real well today. Rolling high.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Werewolves! Next week! Travis Willingham, living his best life.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Herewolves?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Therewolves.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Werewolves.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whywolves. Too many. Too many, sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're all going to grow facial hair for next week, right? You too?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to wear a mustache.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But sincerely, I am very appreciative. Each and every one of you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's maybe a little bit for you, but also for a friend. For-- I'm not good at this, does someone want to?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can do this, if you like.

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: You don't know him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't have to know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your friend and ours, Mollymauk, is no longer of this world, and this would be a way of us saying-- putting his legacy at peace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we can afford it, no promises.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It depends on how much is left, because we don't have a ton of money.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm just musing on how we found him and how we left him."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which was?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A brief star burning very bright, but twice as short. But no, when we found him outside of the "forests up north, he had no memory, no voice, no words. He was basically a vegetable. But over "time, he came back to his senses, and yeah. It's a shame. He was a good one."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We were fond of him, and he was fond of you, so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well. That's the dangers of the world we live in, I suppose."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know you've taken this burden on yourself, but I think we would all feel a bit better if you would accept this as a small thank you, for then and now as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's more than a thank you. I feel that you have to be free, so that you can finally pay your debt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is me, paying my debt."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're a man who is afraid of what you owe. I understand. That's okay. It'll feel so much better when you're finally free from this belief.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is my responsibility."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is not your debt. Your debt lies elsewhere. I know these things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caduceus. What the hell?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why don't you make some tea and shut the fuck up for a second?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anyway, I should finish my meal."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It'll be your last one in here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes over and grabs the bowl, and quietly, while looking at Caduceus, begins to eat his gray mush.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you tell the future?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you tell the past?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just know a guilty man when I see one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Is he a guilty man?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we out of earshot?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is he a bad guy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move out of earshot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, excuse me."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caduceus! What was that? Where did that come from?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He doesn't want to leave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He looks really happy in here, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's not even happy, he's hiding in here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, then, maybe we should leave him in here, if he feels unsafe on the outside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not that he feels unsafe, you can just see-- it's all over his face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't-- just looks like a dude.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can tell that just from looking at him?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can tell a lot from people just by looking at them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you think when you look at me?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's an entire conversation for later.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caduceus, how will Fjord-- how and when will Fjord die?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In a terrible crash.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With a man named Buick (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, so back to the situation at hand. You are suggesting we continue doing what we're doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to see-- I think this is a man who needs to be free so that he can be at peace with himself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And where are you getting all of this insight?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) His brain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why would you not want to-- why would you want to be in a cell? Why would you want to stay there? Someone's offering you freedom for nothing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've been in a cell. It's not fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's hiding something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not arguing prison politics--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, let's find out how much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree with you, I just feel like there's a supernatural situation going on here that you're not necessarily telling us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just know-- I just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Norda returns, coming shuffling back down with a small, leather-bound journal or book of some kind. "All right. Looking at this one, keeping tabs on what he's able to "make, the reparations he's made, the amounts of money he was able to have brought in from friends "to help pay the debt, we're still sitting at about 2,100 gold pieces."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought it was 2,000 to start?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will throw some money at this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't have any money to throw at this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's kind of rich for my blood.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I guess I have a little money to throw at this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we put all of our money together, how much would it be?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would there be a buyout cost, if we wanted to pay it? Is that just the straight-- or could there be some sort of deal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you asking?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What are you-- a buyout?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Weirdly-- and I dont know, you've spent more time with him-- but he strikes me as a man who's, weirdly, happier in jail right now than he'd be out of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's fucking weird, I'll tell you that."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think he needs to face some stuff. It would be really healthy for everyone involved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, you tall, magical cow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 12.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispers) This got weird so quickly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tell you what, you go ahead and toss down about 1,700 right now? I'll kick his ass out."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll put 400 gold down right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can put 50 gold in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, save your 50 gold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gustav has come back to the bars and is like, "You all are being absurdly generous--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's no generosity in this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "--and this is not necessary at all. I mean it, I mean it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can put down a thousand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Gold?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're at 14, we need three more.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will put in 100 gold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She wanted to do 1,700?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are at 15 now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I throw in 165 that's Molly's, but also, hang on. Before we do all this. Listen, Norda, I know we caused a lot of a headache for you when all this was going down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You were one of many. There's at least, at any given point in time, 17 headaches in here, so "yeah, that's one of them."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're trying to do a good thing. A man in jail doesn't do anything for your city, but I bet 1,500 right now would.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't have to empty the bedpans, change the sheets.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't have to feed him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The crownsguard to the left of you goes, "You should listen to her. Those bedpans are "pretty terrible."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Think of what you can do for this town with 1,500 gold right now, because let me tell you, we can't give you that 1,700. So we either walk and you're stuck with a prisoner for another nine months, or you take the 1,500.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This will be at a higher DC.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I assist this as a charismatic fucking half-orc?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you say to assist her?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Interpretive dance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jazz hands!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as the Lawmaster's eyebrow raises to the--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I wink.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the first time since you've seen Norda, you see a smile curl across her face. She goes, "If that's not the weirdest thing I've seen in some time." Make your check with advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey! Natural 20! Yeah, jazz hands work every fucking time!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was the other number?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, okay, still good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "1,500 and we'll call it even."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I gave you four.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much was it? I've got 165 that was Molly's.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is like us trying to figure out a check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, isn't it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can throw in money as well, because that was part of my goal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just keep 65 and spend 100 of Molly's, to keep it simple.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a thousand, 300--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 400. I think it was 400, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you only need a hundred.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm keeping my money, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott threw down a thousand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Solid.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I already knocked it off. Thank you, Nott.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The crownsguard begin gathering the money from you guys and bringing over small chests to put the large amount of coin over. As this is happening, Gustav leans his back towards the stones at the edge, and his eyes are just wide in disbelief. "I don't know what to say."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Say thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Wand of Smiles at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the DC on that? Is it a charisma save?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a charisma save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a natural eight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good, you have to smile!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He sits there, eyes wide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay, he's so happy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Congratulations. For some odd reason, these folks decided that you were worth a lot of money to not "be here, so be thankful that somehow the great gods have looked down upon you and Erathis "decided, 'You know what, fuck law! You're free.'" So the guards escort him out. You guys all head to the outside. You all get led outside of the stockade and Norda says, "All right, well, that's "been a pleasure. I'm going to go ahead and go home, have a drink, and get some fucking sleep."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Excellent idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't get anyone else killed." She heads back inside. Gustav is stepping out there, his hat that he just had retrieved and given back to him, he puts on, steadies his coat, grabs the small sack of his personal belongings and turns around to the rest of you. "I-- (laughs) Thank you. This "is more than I would have expected."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What will you do now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know. I mean, the circus is scattered. I would ask where Yasha was-- she would "be a good right-hand man-- but I don't see her around. Did she also--?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, she took off like she does.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your guess is as good as ours.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe you could find her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's up north.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're heading to the Menagerie Coast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Huh, Menagerie Coast. Haven't been there in a long time."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're more than welcome to hop on the wagon, if you want. Can't promise much more beyond that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I'm fine. Thank you, I appreciate it. I should probably tie up some loose ends now that I "have availability to do so. Thanks to you and your generosity."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A word of advice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Mm-hmm?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whatever was keeping you in this cell, whatever was making you comfortable in here, be careful of it. There's something inside you that's trying to put you in a box. Whatever guilt you're feeling, whatever thing that you feel that you're to blame for, I would unload that burden. If not on us, on somebody, although we're happy to take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intimidation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Intimidation is fine. I was trying to be kind of nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It can ride a line.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Until then, let Gustav Fletching be forever your humble servant."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you mean that? Like, if we ever need you, can we hit you up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's an expression.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah but I'm asking because he offered.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sure, I've got nothing else going on. Come find me."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't need you right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, then come find me!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll send you a message, don't you worry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's such a strange, gangly elf. You've never quite seen an individual of his physicality.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Boy, not that any of us can complain, but that guy likes to lay it on thick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's very sad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord does this mean I'm not the most abrasive person in the group any more?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know if Deuce is abrasive; just sort of awkward, aloof.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, just blunt.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I see funny rocks, I see funny people, and this is not sitting right, there's something unnatural about the build.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When you drink tea made of dead people, you see things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I toss Caduceus a little pouch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to make a dexterity check to see if I catch it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If that's okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (sneezes)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bless you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (sneezes)

lines.name: LAURA, MATT
lines.text: Bless you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's more of a--. You have to save it, but you catch it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Figured since you put down so much money for a stranger to be busted out, a little bit of reimbursement.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Appreciate that, that's nice of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why? Why'd you do it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I told you why. I told him why. Because it's not healthy to sit there and just hide from your problems.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a lot of money for an esoteric reason.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it?

lines.name: LIAM, TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How much money was it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 400 gold!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, how much is that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a lot!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where did you even get that gold?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We all divided it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's tea for life.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seems fair.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we will--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How much money was that amount?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 65, thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll give you a little lessons in economics as we travel, just for fucking future parley situations.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, what's the point of having gold if you're not using it for something? I mean, otherwise it's just something that's making it heavier to walk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's a lot of reasons.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sounds odd, but all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we'll get into it, we got time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys make your way back to the Nestled Nook Inn, having seen what has become of Gustav and changed the trajectory of his journey as well, you all ruminate on the rather large sum of money you've given for what you hope is a good cause, have another drink, and find your way to bed. And that's where we'll take a break!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You spent a thousand gold!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Worth it! Fucking worth it! I'm feeling it. I'm feeling the vibe: the vibe was that it was worth it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was really interesting. I wasn't expecting that!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was, by the way, the best whisper I've ever had. I'm not telling them at all what you said, but that was amazing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was a 27 insight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We need a damn whisper cam.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was deep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was gonna toss in way more, but you guys picked up the check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm happy to take it. This was definitely my instigation, so I should bear the brunt of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So thank you, whoever runs the Critical Role Wiki.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm gonna go open and look at Wikipedia. I found it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have tonight as part of our Wyrmwood giveaway-- ah! Let's open up. Oh! This is the purpleheart dice tower.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's mine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which has the Desert of Din'Tely fantastic grain-in art from Deven Rue.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Looks so good on the purpleheart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks so fantastic! It really does. This dice tower set comes together, magnetizes to assemble into an awesome dice tower. This will be given away at the end of the break to one lucky winner. So you need to hop on over to the Critical Role Twitch chat during the break, that's twitch.tv/criticalrole and enter, only once, the word "coast." C-O-A-S-T. More than once--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Deep meaning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll come back here at the end of the break, and we'll have a winner to announce, see you here in a minute! If I can close the box! There we go!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's in the box?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back, and that was super late.

lines.name: MARISHA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Way late!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Intentionally late.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Welcome back. So, first off, we have our winner. And our winner of the giveaway for this fantastic Wyrmwood Purple Heart Box Deven Rue art scroll thing--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --is tempyyy. T-E-M-P-Y-Y-Y. Tempyyy, congratulations, we'll have that sent out to you ASAP. Well done. We'll have a new one to give you guys next week for the next giveaway. And thank you for our fine friends at Wyrmwood for being amazing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Put that away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wish Laura hadn't quit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She just was like, "I'm out."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She was so good on the show.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right out the front door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm trying to figure out what it is. Is it DPB? Is that right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: DPB, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, this is not going away, is it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Big peanut butter energy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're over big dick energy. BDE is gone, DPB is in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The best part is when people try to explain it to other people, and they're like, "What does it mean?" And they say, "Dick in the peanut butter," and they'll be like (disbelieving) "No, what does it really mean?" It's dick in the peanut butter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Schlurp.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --in Trostenwald, in the tavern, you rest up. The following morning, as the sun rises into the sky, you have your meals, you prepare yourselves for the next leg of your journey. Is there anything else you wish to accomplish while in Trostenwald, or do you wish to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do my pushups and my pullups.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Totally. Got to keep it going. Upkeep, it's important for a monk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm working on it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do my meditation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau works out more than I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Different kind of working out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a place called Natural Remedies, maybe? Or maybe the general store? I don't know if it's possible-- Can I get components to make a Tanglefoot Bag? The chemicals needed for that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a chemical thing, Travis. You wouldn't understand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you pretending to have actually looked in the Player's Handbook for once?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I did not. I looked on the printout that Matt gave me. The one page that I needed to play the game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah. Indeed, there is Natural Remedies, there is the Lochward General. What are you looking for, specifically?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do I need for that, for goopy stuff? Tar? I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Peanut butter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be tar and other--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it a chemical thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's a series of chemicals. Tar, amber, resin, and things that are pulled from tree sap. There are other processes where you can distill that down, along with some more crude clays, to create this kind of adhesive. If you'd like to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'll turn into a little gnome or something, and go around and shop, and get all the components I might need.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you can go ahead and do that. Go ahead and make a general deception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy. Yeah, that's a two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, but deception's a minus three, so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So negative one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow. What does the other side of failure look like?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Weird minotaur.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go ahead and meet with Simon Earth of the Natural Remedies shop. You can acquire the goods you need at the cost-- specifically, the materials that you're trying to make if you're trying to do something alchemical-- at the cost of what it requires.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get through one round of discussions with him before you begin to notice crownsguard getting interested in your presence. One of them, for some reason, his eye caught you strange and he noticed something odd about the illusion and your physicality and seems to be-- You and this shop don't have a very good history.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're half gnome and half minotaur.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just the horse butt on the top.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You say loudly as you exit the facility. The crownsguard are keeping a distance, but they're definitely trailing you from about 25, 30 feet behind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Boy. It's a cold day. I think I'll just pop up my hood and walk a little brisker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They walk a little brisker, keeping pace with you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe just-- Oh look, what's that? And I'll run into an alley that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a stealth check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Advantage. Ooh, that's even worse! 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear the crownsguard round the corner and run inside and begin looking around. You see them pushing barrels over, and one of them who seems to be leading this charge is like, "Well, fucking hell, where the hell did she go? It's probably just my brain playing tricks on me." And you hear them slowly walk away. They weren't fully invested in a chase. They were more just mistrusting and curious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It would be so easy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (whispers) Their families must know pain.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I'll just rejoin the others.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have all your stuff gathered together to continue the rest of this journey. If you want to do anything alchemical, it will take time with the kit to do so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The dice have spoken, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So! Gathered up, back onto the cart, who is leading this next leg of the journey? Is it continuing, Caduceus?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm really enjoying this. I get to see this wonderful countryside.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll drive for a bit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I haven't taken a shift yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so the two of you make your way to the front of the cart, and get heading southward. It is four days of travel to the Wuyun Gate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To the what gate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the Wuyun Gate. It's the southern gates that mark the very edge of the southern portion of the Empire. So. Go ahead and make a perception check. Since Beau is helping you, with advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19, okay. We'll say, for the sake of brevity here, the first two days of travel, thanks to your tent as well and staying off the beaten path during times of rest, you manage to find some good hidden areas and no issues happen at night during the restful period. The second day goes by without issue. You do see a small grouping of merchants making their way northward with largely what is a chain of oxen. It looks like they have about 12 or so of them that are chained together and they're heading northward, having made their way through the gates, for some sort of a sale or trade. It's a curious spectacle as they come by. It's one cart and just a lot of oxen, giant horns, slowly making their way northward. As you pass around for the third day and fourth day, go ahead and make another perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Again with advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Damn!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Rocking it today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Apparently. Which brings you to a total of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Geocache! Geocache! Geocache! More hidden treasure!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your vision catches a troupe of about 50 or so soldiers. Not dressed in the same bits of armor as the crownsguard that you've seen as you've traversed most of this countryside, but a different set of armor. Largely bright red maroons and golds. Looks like there are some tents and there's an encampment set on this side, off to the eastern edge of the gate.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mr. Fjord, what do you think of that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To be honest with you, Caduceus, that was not here the last time I was here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you recognize those uniforms?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are the Righteous Brand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, they're the Righteous Brand. I remember maybe a tenth of that. I assume border tensions are pretty high.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we okay with these people or should we--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we should be fine. After all, we're leaving, we're not entering.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are stopping one by one and going through and poking and prodding and moving things in the carts to look for any stowaways; looking for hidden materials. In this time of warfare, it looks like there is a very thorough process. And you can see the gates are open--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far to the gate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are about 300 feet away. He caught a vision of it very distantly and you guys are-- They haven't quite noticed your presence yet or if they've noticed it, they haven't taken stock of it because they're focused on their task.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've traveled four days to the south to the Wuyun Gates.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we're about to get--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Border patrol.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Border patrol's there and they're checking every wagon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You and I came through when we were coming north and there were a couple guards. Now there's like 50.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It needs to be empty the way it looks. We need to hop out now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Caduceus let's pull off to the side and try to find some cover in the woods. Is there woods to cover behind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope! It is--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a gorge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the mountain range has come together into this central gorge. What was previously tall grass plains with rolling hills and bits of rock has thinned out to be bits of scrub and then hard rock floor. You've left the central valley and you're hitting more mountainous terrain.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Perhaps we empty the cart, walk on foot and say we're looking to go out and bring goods and wares back into the Empire.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just don't want to bring a cart with a magical tarp over it, that's designed for smuggling humans.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, the tarp isn't magical. The cart is magical.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there a way to turn off the effect?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It just looks like a cart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It needs to be empty the way it looks when they poke at it. So I think we should all spill out now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll walk outside? Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's got to be a way to turn off the enchantment, maybe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an arcana check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a button?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm probably not the person the make an arcana check for this, but here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're the one who had the question.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope. That is a natural one. Which gives me a zero.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You contemplate over this enchantment that they've told you about the cart. You guys watch as Caduceus stares out into space a bit before this trickle of blood begins to come of his nostril.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you okay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caduceus, you've got a little--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah. That's--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does that happen when you think really hard?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just on a whim do you want to try to dispel the enchantment the way you did--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dispel? But then it won't come back!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But then it won't work!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It may not come back is the thought.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I kind of like having--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have Dispel Magic, but--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What would I know about using that spell to make this go away; temporarily or for good?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to-- Make an arcana check yourself, actually.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what I'm after. That is 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If they're very powerful items, then there are sometimes means of temporarily subduing the enchantment. Objects that are a little more common, or the enchantments themselves are not as thorough, it is a dispel and gone type scenario.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, let's roll off of this thing and take a walk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How about this? What about this? There's-- we're not the only cart on the road, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On this side of the road? You're the only one. There is one that is in the gates right now that's full inspection, and you can now see, from this distance that Caduceus has pointed out, beyond the open gates, you can see a cluster of other carts. There's a line trying to make their way--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Waiting to come back through. We could plant some contraband on one of those carts. In the kerfuffle, they'll be like, "Hey, you! You guys are arrested, you're under arrest!" And we'll be like, "Oh, we'll just skate through."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think they're trying to arrest people on the way out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They are searching both ways, it looks like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it will be easier to get out of the Empire than back in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let them poke sticks in here and find nothing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you think we're okay if we all pile out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If they poke the stick in, the stick will disappear.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What kind of contraband do we have? We've got a couple pouches of fungus and that's about it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have human jerky.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They won't know that it's human.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If I tell them it is--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How about don't do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but if they find the lot of us going (grunts) when they look in, that's bad, but if they poke at it and say, "What's with this cart?", we say it's a very good cart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I agree. Let's risk it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm getting out of the cart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, all of us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If they reached in to be like, "Oh, are there hidden compartments?", would they see their arm disappear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Their arm would essentially vanish as they put their arm through the illusion.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or if they're like, "I'm going to climb up and check this out, Frank," and then they're like, "Frank!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The cart isn't covered. Let's just make it look totally empty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And if they ask why there's nothing, we have a story, right? We're going to go pick up a shipment and bring it back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nothing wrong with having an invisible cart.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just me. I'll do the talking, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or maybe Fjord would be good at that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to focus on the thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, the dodeca?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shouldn't Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shouldn't I, since I've never done it before?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, actually, I was going to say, you haven't done it yet. I think that--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, Fjord, you focus on it. Right as I started to focus on it, you can steal it from me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will take the bag away and swivel it over to Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But I don't underst-- (groans) (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In that brief moment, Fjord--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit, maybe she will come to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --you feel this momentary release, like a tether that previously had gone unseen is loosened. And there, in that brief bit of unexpected free-floating freedom amongst the darkness, that warm, gray, centered energy drifts towards you. Your fight-or-flight kicks in momentarily, but you consciously recall that your friends have been through this. Seems safe. And with that, it drifts towards you, and, in this weird, familiar sense, you've had more than one object just enter your torso. As it warmly touches your chest and dissipates within the inside of your body, your consciousness shifts back out of your concentration mode on the dodecahedron, and you can feel that lingering warmth still around your sternum beneath your armor as you release your hands from the object.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a hell of a thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Calm yourself, Jester. Lock it up. Lock it up. Mount up, let's do this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: By mount up, he means everybody walk next to the cart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as you all-- Walking alongside your cart towards the Wuyun Gates, the crownsguard begin to take notice of your presence, and you can see the one cart that was being inspected at the gates is given, apparently, the clear. They load their materials back into it and begin making their way northward, passing you as you head south.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to change into another form of some sort.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of which sort?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just a halfling. Or a tiny halfling lady.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to hit a point-- and there's enough room for maybe three carts to make it through here, but they're keeping it a two-lane scenario here, this pincher point. There is a cart now that's begun inspection, and about three different crownsguard are going through and rifling and lifting things out of the way. As you begin to approach, the crownsguard put a hand up and guide you over with hand signals to the area to the immediate right of it, around ten feet to the west of the other cart. The captain approaches. You can see a woman in brownish red hair, a bit sun-bleached at the tips, pulled up into a soft ponytail high on the head, and the crownsguard armor itself looks well-kept. You can see from the decorations, as you've seen it before, this is a captain. Approaches. "Halt. What is your business, and where are you going?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are but merchants heading south, down to Nicodranas and Port Damali, in search of goods and wares.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. And what are you carrying across the border, please?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nothing but this cart. We are full of coin and yet have no products for trade. We hope to fix that south of the border.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whistles) Two of the crownsguard come over towards the cart and goes, "But what is within these sacks and small boxes?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, we totally emptied the cart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You emptied the cart, but the illusion-- I've explained multiple times-- is an illusion of standard sacks and boxes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if none of us fully understood that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like, at all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did not.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: May I?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a preventative measure against theft. You can feel free to inspect the cart yourself, if you like.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So truthful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Appreciate you being forthright." The two other guards come forward, and you watch as they place their blades into and watch them vanish and go like--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's kind of neat, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Dualla!" The captain approaches, and herself leans in and pulls back. "You are not incorrect, you carry nothing on your carts. This is a curious nature of an enchantment, indeed. And you said you're heading to Nicodranas and Port Damali to acquire goods. What are you looking to acquire?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Some simple fabrics, meats. My friends haven't sampled the cuisine down there, and I was hoping to show them a bit of the Menagerie Coast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ugh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If it's really bad, you can roll again!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's right, I'm going to do that! That's better. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She gives you a close look, not leaving direct eyeline to your pupils and hers, and watches you through the entire statement, and then, "Very well. Move along."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We look forward to seeing you on our return.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, the inspection will be far more thorough that time."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I figure we're not difficult faces to remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Stay safe."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The boundaries-- who knows what's wandering from the dark side of Xhorhas there? Eyes on your backs. Go!" And the crownsguard pull away, and the ones on the opposite end open the space for you guys to move your cart along. With that, you pass through the gates of the Wuyun Gorge.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do the gates look any different since the last time we were there? Scratch marks? More wear and tear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're like the one happy person at the DMV.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's now ten. The Righteous Brand themselves, while about 30 or so of them have been encamped in that one encampment, the rest, of about 20 or so, are scattered amongst different points on the mountains around the gate and are all scouts, keeping eyes out for anyone trying to circumvent the pinch point. There's pretty heavy interest in keeping watch on these borders, given the current conflict to the east. But you pass through safely, allowed by the crownsguard, and within a few moments, you pass into the Wuyun Gorge proper, and a wave of acknowledgement hits most of you that, for the first time, you are no longer in the Dwendalian Empire. So you pass by the six or seven carts that are in line, and there's arguments and frustration. Some of them are currently very vehemently arguing with the crownsguard who are holding them to wait their turn. You keep your heads down and continue forward. There, you start heading into this large mountain pass. Extremely steep at certain points, where the mountains seem to be have been carved down or bisected by some ancient cataclysm, whether it be the Calamity or some great natural disaster long before that. It seems to be a very unique, singular cleft down in the center of these two mountains that breaks the mountain range between the Cyrios and the Ashkeeper. Who's keeping-- you're at the front of this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a perception check for me, please.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No advantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on, Deuce. Drop that deuce.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a 27.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He did it again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am rocking today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What languages do you know?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know Common, Elvish, Giant, Sylvan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: More whispers?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah, he knows everything!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's an elven giant.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Buddy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caduceus MVP tonight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, he's on a roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: May this carry you into the playa well, my friend.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was that? I heard some of the whisper. I heard it was crazy!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's giants up ahead.

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where up ahead?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Shh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You didn't tell me we were going to giant--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get back in the cart! Get in the cart!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. Do I know where the voice came from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that roll? Yes, you would. Looking ahead-- and you guys have traveled a number of hours past the gates-- about 30 feet ahead of you, behind one of these rock formations, you can see the vague outline of some sort of large, hulking figure leaned against it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the outside of a humanoid shoulder and the back of a matted bit of greased hair, maybe standing 15 feet tall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's about 30 feet away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about 30 feet ahead of you and to the right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. I think he's planning on ambushing us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to cast--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just one I can see, although he's talking to someone-- I'm going to cast Calm Emotions over there just to see what that does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just a little chamomile. It's calming. A little lavender.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a 20-foot bomb in all that section I can't see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. So it's a charisma saving throw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Against 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a natural five with a minus one. That's going to be a no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Atta boy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nice, Tal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who's this Tal you speak of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The tension-- and you guys can, as Caduceus has pointed out this figure, you can see it tense against the stone, and you see it was reaching down. Just out of sight, there was some large rocky formation that it had its arms on, and it leans back a bit and shakes its head, and as it pulls just beyond the outline of the rock, you can see a second head right next to the first. Two heads on one set of shoulders. They both shake away from each other, then together and away, and one looks to the other and just waves in your direction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What are they wearing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mostly no clothing other than a bit of tattered leather and hide and furs that are matted around the midsection and dangling almost past the knees.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just going to calmly keep moving the cart by them, and I'm just going to wave back and say, "That's some great leather you're wearing there. You look great."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you fucking kidding me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the cart moves past, another voice, also in giant, comes across the way. You guys hear: (yelling in Giant). You look over to the other side, and from around another rock, you see another one of them who's looking livid at the other one. Go ahead and make an arcan-- this would be-- technically, it's a giant--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They also don't see any of you. They just see me and whoever's sitting up front right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a general intelligence check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's right, it's just you. I think all of us jumped in the back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If anybody would like to, make a general intelligence check on this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or just him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: General intelligence?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, these are Ettins.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That worked. They're what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ettins are large giant-kin, two-headed beasts, and they don't normally work in pairs-- you know this instinctively-- because they argue enough between their two heads. To have two working together is already a very strained relationship. And the other one who's yelling at the one across the way, as you guys are in between, you recognize it as saying, "What?! Why?! Stupid! Right there! Don't wave!" And the other head goes, "What he said!" I'm going to go ahead and, just for the sake of this, to give you some visual perspective--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, please, bring it. I feel bad that we didn't get to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It may not come to that, but I want to give you a visual.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like-- if you worked so hard on a map, I was feeling a little guilty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt made this map, and you just blew it, Taliesin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am enjoying this character so much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, look at how amazing that map is!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's so much in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, he worked so hard on that!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, let's just attack just 'cause.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And now the Ettin just wants to crochet things with us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys would be right about there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at our beautiful horses. How come one-- Mamma Mia is way prettier than Dancing Queen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so, general positioning: Caduceus would be in the front, with Jester there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay. I was inside, but I'll take it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so tall. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or no, was Beau here in the front?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All of us were in the back except for Taliesin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it was just me at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. That'll work, there. We'll say you're in the cart there. Haphazardly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, because you guys can see this whole thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at your little mini. Your mini's so pretty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Isn't he? Isn't he pretty?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we haven't seen Cadeceus yet.

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Those things are huge!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god. Oh goodness!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And so this is the one that came around this end.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They really have two heads?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They literally have two heads.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's fucking awesome.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That miniature is like the Garbage Pail Kid card that you get 97 of. It is the most frequent find in the box.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ettins?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ettins. Got a lot of Ettins.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So this one, currently under the Calm Emotions, which you're concentrating on. The other one is yelling at it (monster yelling), pointing at you, and the other guy is like (confused monster yelling).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, you seem like a nice guy. You're really listening to this? God. I'm also, still very gently, still moving forward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You guys have got issues, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pushing slowly forward. Trotting along that way. This guy comes out and begins arguing loudly with the other as he comes forward, too, shouting at him, and they're both yelling over both of you now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god. Just keep this going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Language! Come on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: same?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, man. Who doesn't speak Giant? That's just rude.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And the one who you didn't cast it on is like, "You so dumb! You two not listen! Ruin this!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think you're dumb. And I'm just still going. (giggles)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You push ahead a little bit further.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the meantime, I pull out a white feather, and I trace a triangle in the air, and I cast Fear on this one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bless you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And what's the saving throw on that one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a natural 13. And what's the wisdom save?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 13 is the DC.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a Wisdom save, you said? Yeah, that's a failure. So that one--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What. The fuck.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wizards, man!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --goes from arguing and goes like, "Well, fine! You won't finish this, we do it ourselves." And they reach over and grab this large boulder and begin to pick it up, and at that point, Caleb finishes his incantation, and they go (boulder crashing noise), drop it, (monster screaming) and just start running the opposite direction as the cart begins to slowly roll forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is great!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Begins charging off this way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stay all right, my friend. You stay all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I tap Nott on the shoulder--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't let anybody tell you what you can't do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Those two just saw their worst fears.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow! That was incredible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This guy just turns around and begins to like-- waves back to you and heads around that direction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not a concentration, by the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Calm Emotions is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Calm Emotions for me is not. Doesn't-- is not a concentration. No. Yes, it is! You're right, never mind. I don't know how to read spells yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. It also only lasts a minute.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. So, you know, we've been rolling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So these guys both run off the side there--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, we're going. And now I'm booking.

lines.name: MARISHA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Boom, motherfuckers!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Awesome. Fucking awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as you guys continue running--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's so beautiful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We used it. Kind of.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, now he can spin it around and it's a different part of the canyon entirely.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And you have to turn the little marquee again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 100 feet later.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He already did it. He already did it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And now we're in a totally different place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is like old animation where it just repeats and repeats and repeats.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kind of, yeah. So, as you guys continue pressing forward on this path--

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rocks destroy you!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's a rock slide, you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Ettins are throwing boulders at us. Go, go, go!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caduceus, that was amazing!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'd better run.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And Caleb, even better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the horses, moving forward, at a--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I tell the horses, we're going fast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so make an animal handling check, because you're now going into a straight-- just go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Animal handling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Without issue, you, horse speaker Caduceus Clay, give them the intent to go into a gallop and they begin picking up loudly, and you hear the kind of soft neighing as they begin galloping forward, the cart taking up speed. At which point, you hear a voice behind go, "Hey, wait a minute!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The jig is up!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you see as the one with Calm Emotions begins charging forward. Is it a saving throw on Fear every turn?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I assume it is, yeah. Yeah. Where did it go? Where did it go? This is my first time casting it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One minute.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If the creature ends its (mumbling)-- must take the dash action. If a creature--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing with the music)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For the duration. It just says it becomes frightened for the duration.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long is the duration?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One minute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Doesn't say there's any saves?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's concentration--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm looking. Where is it? Do you see it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, if a creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have a direct line of sight on you--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, if it doesn't have line of sight on me, it makes a wisdom save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Horse speed-- pulling the cart, though, it's only going to be about half of that actual horse speed here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go ahead and hop out and try and give the horses less weight to pull, and run alongside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, wow. And (sharp inhale) they're rolling good initiative on their end. All righty, so, 25 to 20?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Noice, noice, noice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. And then we have--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caduceus, then Caleb?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. Or either way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 15 to ten?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Jester voice) Jester, where did you land?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I landed on six.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Aww.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is a sad day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry, Jester. All right, so, Nott, you're up first. They're now like (heavy footfalls) running.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far is the closest one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One head's looking at you and the other's just looking up at the air at a bird that flies overhead. It looks a little spooked (scared grunt). So what are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far is the closest one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The closest one to you, because you're technically in the back of the cart right here--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Technically, you're in the back of the cart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he'd be about 35 feet from you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (snarls) These fucking things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can hold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know. Because I'm hidden from their view, right? As far as I know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you know, yeah. They don't know you're in the cart.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord's in there as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I guess I'll hold. I mean, otherwise I have to shoot at it at disadvantage. Eh! I'll take a shot at disadvantage. I'm hidden, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are, so it doesn't know you're there, so you have advantage, so it's just a single roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D'oh! That's a ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten misses. It goes wide, out of the side, and the head that was watching the bird goes (growling) and peers closer to the cart with an untrusting eye, its chin tilted to the side. This is a terrible look now. You see these very bulbous faces that are a combination of muscle and fat pushing into the eye sockets. They have these tiny, beady giant eyes. You see these round-ish, pushed-in pug noses and this large gaping jaw, ogre-like with two big tusks that protrude from underneath. Long, scraggly dark beards that pour down the sides of their face and over the front of their chest, mingling with matted bits of chest hair over this tanned and sun-weathered flesh, uncovered, made of sheer muscle and anger. You can see each head has its own series of scars and weird personality and as they're running, they're still arguing with each other as they're in the process of getting to you. "We need to go from the side!" "No! Direct attack!" On this end, the other one goes like: "Budak, don't be stupid!" The other head's like: "But Budak's our friend." "Shut up!" That the end of your turn, Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can bonus action fire again, or I can get off this cart of death that they're going to be swinging at pretty soon. I'll just shoot again. Oh boy. 17.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're big.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits the guy over here, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sneak attack or no?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he still hasn't quite seen you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's great!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It shot out there, but he's not quite sure what's going on. They're not very intelligent creatures, you get the idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh. Not bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll use Fury of the Small. So that's 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 points of damage. Nice. As they're running, the bolt lets loose and goes right into the lower jaw of the one on the left, the one that was being referred to as Bodak.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bodak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Budak.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Budak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it hits, goes (gargling) and starts reaching up with the hand that's holding the club to try and pull the bolt out while the other head goes: "Come on! Put your weight into it!" And just keeps charging forward. That end your turn, Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Beau, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
